author: Autoblog
title: Amazon's secret renewed section features Beats, iPads and more ‚Äî save up to 70%
text:
Why you can trust us We independently evaluate the products we review. When you buy via links on our site, we may receive compensation. Read more about how we vet products and deals .
Yahoo Life Shopping We found a hidden Amazon page for like-new tech, home and kitchen gear ‚Äî save up to 60% Score big markdowns on top brands like Apple, Samsung, Vitamix and more with Amazon Renewed. Yahoo Life Shopping Editors Updated April 11, 2024 at 11:10 PM 5 Link Copied Read full article Spring is a time for renewal ‚Äî Amazon Renewal! (Amazon)
We all know that Amazon is bursting with deals on brand-new products. But did you know that a world of even more ridonculous bargains awaits you at Am azo n Re n ewed ? What, pray tell, is Amazon Renewed? It's a little-known Amazon section where you can find refurbished electronics, home goods and kitchen gear for up to 60% off retail. We'll give you a minute to take that in.
Quick Overview Samsung 43-Inch The Frame TV (Renewed) $697 $998 Save $301 See at Amazon Apple iPad, 32GB (Renewed) $172 $200 Save $28 See at Amazon Apple iPhone 12, 64GB, Fully Unlocked (Renewed) $259 $398 Save $139 See at Amazon Lenovo 11.6" 300e Chromebook (Renewed) $80 $198 Save $118 See at Amazon Shark AI Ultra Robot Vacuum (Renewed) $200 $400 Save $200 See at Amazon Dyson Pure Cool Link Air Purifier, (Renewed) $339 $599 Save $260 See at Amazon Ninja EzView Max XL Air Fryer (Renewed) $90 $166 Save $76 See at Amazon Vitamix A2500 Ascent Series Smart Blender (Renewed) $450 $600 Save $150 See at Amazon Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) $89 $129 Save $40 See at Amazon JBL Wireless Headphones $40 $50 Save $10 See at Amazon Apple AirPods Pro (2nd Generation) $190 $249 Save $59 See at Amazon Insignia 24-Inch Fire TV $70 $90 Save $20 See at Amazon Vizio 40-Inch Smart TV $148 $230 Save $82 See at Amazon Amazon 50-Inch Fire TV $330 $450 Save $120 See at Amazon Otvoc 16-Inch Laptop $390 $1,299 Save $909 See at Amazon Qinlianf 5-Outlet Extender $10 $20 Save $10 See at Amazon Apple iPad (9th Generation) $249 $329 Save $80 See at Amazon Jejill Portable Charger $14 $60 Save $46 with coupon See at Amazon Apple AirTag $24 $29 Save $5 See at Amazon See 14 more Ready? Okay, here's how it works. Amazon accepts trade-ins on top products from popular brands, inspects and refurbishes these items, then makes them available ‚Äî in like-new form ‚Äî at shockingly low prices. And for you skeptics out there, take a chill pill: Every item is backed by the Amazon Renewed Guarantee, which promises a replacement or refund within 90 days if it doesn't work to your satisfaction.
As for the fine print: Products will arrive in excellent working order, tested and thoroughly cleaned by professional technicians. Some may not ship in their original packaging, but they'll come complete with needed accessories. And while some items might not be entirely scratch-free, Amazon guarantees "no visible cosmetic imperfections when held at an arm‚Äôs length." Meaning, though the items are not new -new, you'll hardly be able to tell the difference ‚Äî except in terms of the money you're saving. Here are some of the steals available at Amazon Renewed:
Tech Amazon Samsung 43-Inch The Frame TV (Renewed) $697 $998 Save $301 Few TVs have built up a cult following like The Frame, which can display artwork and photos when your TV is "off." While they're not cheap, you can snag this model for less than $700 ‚Äî a new one would run you nearly $1,000!
"I love this TV," shared a happy customer . "It is beautiful. I don‚Äôt watch much TV, so the idea of it being a visually appealing item sold me. I don‚Äôt really know what is 'refurbished' about it, as there haven‚Äôt been any issues."
$697 at Amazon Amazon Apple iPad, 32GB (Renewed) $172 $200 Save $28 A long battery life and fantastic resolution will have you glued to this device all day long. Apple products don't often go on sale, and new iPads can cost upward of $300, making this a worthwhile deal.
One satisfied shopper wrote: "I bought this in acceptable condition, just taking a chance. Well, I am quite happy. Didn‚Äôt want to spend the full money for a new iPad ... If I leave the Wi-Fi off, it barely uses any power. [For] three days I haven‚Äôt charged it and [it's] still at 88%. My old iPad turned off in six hours, no matter how many settings I changed. If anything changes I‚Äôll update, but it came in great shape physically and I‚Äôm not noticing any internal issues." (Psst: This one comes in "excellent" condition.)
$172 at Amazon Amazon Apple iPhone 12, 64GB, Fully Unlocked (Renewed) $259 $398 Save $139 Having a smartphone is essential, and if you'd rather not shell out for a full-priced iPhone, this one arrives in "excellent" condition for under $300. The No. 1 bestseller comes unlocked and ready to pair with your preferred carrier, has 64GB of memory storage and comes in six colors (prices vary).
"After receiving the phone, visually, it literally looks brand new," raved a reviewer . "Not a single scratch on it anywhere. So far [it] has worked flawlessly, [the] battery time is of that of a new phone. Perhaps it‚Äôs luck of the draw, but the phone was literally like buying a brand-new phone."
$259 at Amazon Amazon Lenovo 11.6" 300e Chromebook (Renewed) $80 $198 Save $118 Looking for an affordable laptop that'll cover the basics? Your search ends here, thanks to this ridiculously discounted bestseller ‚Äî it's 60% off! You can use it as a laptop or tablet, since it has a unique folding design and touchscreen capability. With an average battery life of 10 hours, you'll be able to browse the web, video chat with friends and family, check emails and, of course, shop at Amazon all day!
"I wanted a low-cost computer that I could use to write my novel on the go," explained a fan . "This gets the job done and more. I got one in "excellent" used condition. Out of the box, it felt like a brand-new product, with no scratches or any defects whatsoever. The battery life is amazing. I wrote for six hours and there was barely any drain. ... [The] touch screen is very responsive and the keyboard/touchpad works great."
$80 at Amazon Home and kitchen Amazon Shark AI Ultra Robot Vacuum (Renewed) $200 $400 Save $200 Self-emptying robovacs do not come cheap, especially the ones from top brands. That's why this $200 Shark is such an impressive deal (you're saving 50%). It boasts an insane 120 minutes of run time before needing a recharge, and the self-emptying base can hold up to 30 days of gunk.
"I‚Äôm obsessed," gushed a content cleaner . "Worked and looked like a brand new product ... Setup was super fast and we‚Äôve already had it do a few cleaning runs! It‚Äôs much quieter than I expected it to be, I‚Äôve had friends with robot vacuums that really drown out everything else in the room but this only gets a little loud when it‚Äôs emptying into the canister. I love it."
$200 at Amazon Amazon Dyson Pure Cool Link Air Purifier, (Renewed) $339 $599 Save $260 Dyson is well respected for its thoughtfully engineered products ‚Äî and they've got sky-high prices to match. That said, you can score this sleek air purifier just in time to help with spring allergies for over 40% off. And not only that, it doubles as a fan to keep you cool on those sweltering summer days.
"I put this up in the bedroom to help with my wife's allergies," shared a shopper . "The setup was a snap, took all of about five minutes. I was able to immediately configure the purifier from the mobile app as well as schedule evening hours for quieter run time. I really like the ability to monitor the filter life from the app as well as the daily/monthly monitoring of air quality."
$339 at Amazon Amazon Ninja EzView Max XL Air Fryer (Renewed) $90 $166 Save $76 Crispy, crunchy delights await, thanks to this roomy air fryer. It has a 5.5-quart capacity that can hold up to three pounds of fries or wings, but what sets this model apart is the transparent door, which lets you keep an eye on your food while it cooks. This one's a hot 45% off!
"I got it for my stepdad for Christmas and it has been great," wrote a gift-giver . "It has become an everyday [appliance]. I definitely recommend."
$90 at Amazon Amazon Vitamix A2500 Ascent Series Smart Blender (Renewed) $450 $600 Save $150 If you take your smoothies seriously, you won't find a more powerful blitzer than a Vitamix. And while refurbished models still aren't cheap, you'll be saving $150 with this one. It has settings for hot soup, smoothies and frozen desserts along with 17 programs for whipping up every blended creation under the sun. Plus, it's got a built-in timer and offers access to over 500 recipes via the app.
"This thing is a beast," declared a fan . "I make protein shakes every day ... This blender has no problem breaking all of the ingredients down into one delicious, perfectly blended smoothie in 50 seconds flat. ... The refurbished model looks and works as if it were brand new and comes with a 5-year warranty."
$450 at Amazon So, unless you just enjoy paying more, save with Amazon Renewed. You'll find products in 12 major categories:
Smartphones
Computers
Home & Kitchen
Tools
Smartwatches
Gaming
Tablets
Cameras
Lawn & Garden
Office Products
Home Entertainment
Headphones
The reviews quoted above reflect the most recent versions at the time of publication.
Looking for more great Amazon tech deals? Check these out: Headphones and earbuds Apple AirPods (2nd Generation) $89 $129 Save $40 See at Amazon JBL Wireless Headphones $40 $50 Save $10 See at Amazon Apple AirPods Pro (2nd Generation) $190 $249 Save $59 See at Amazon TVs and home entertainment Insignia 24-Inch Fire TV $70 $90 Save $20 See at Amazon Vizio 40-Inch Smart TV $148 $230 Save $82 See at Amazon Amazon 50-Inch Fire TV $330 $450 Save $120 See at Amazon Tablets and tech Otvoc 16-Inch Laptop $390 $1,299 Save $909 See at Amazon Qinlianf 5-Outlet Extender $10 $20 Save $10 See at Amazon Apple iPad (9th Generation) $249 $329 Save $80 See at Amazon Jejill Portable Charger $14 $60 Save $46 with coupon See at Amazon Apple AirTag $24 $29 Save $5 See at Amazon View comments

author: felix-castellanos
title: Estas son las ubicaciones de 39 radares que actualmente no emiten multas por cuestionamientos a contratos | Ecuador | Noticias | El Universo
text: La Comisi√≥n de Tr√°nsito del Ecuador (CTE) ha difundido en su cuenta en la plataforma X, antes Twitter, informaci√≥n sobre la ubicaci√≥n de 39 radares que desde este martes, 4 de junio, dejaron de generar multas en tres provincias: Los R√≠os, El Oro y Ca√±ar. La entidad suspendi√≥ el registro del valor de multas de tr√°nsito captadas por estas c√°maras que corresponden a los contratos con los consorcios Seviecu y Ecutransit. [CTE suspende el registro del valor de multas de tr√°nsito de 39 radares desde este martes, 4 de junio](https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/ecuador/39-radares-cte-suspende-registro-del-valor-de-multas-de-transito-nota/) La decisi√≥n se adopt√≥ luego de que, ante una alerta de presuntas irregularidades en el concurso y manejo de los radares a nivel nacional, la Secretar√≠a General de Integridad P√∫blica dispusiera acciones que involucran a las instancias de control del Estado ecuatoriano. Publicidad A la ciudadan√≠a:‚Äî Comisi√≥n de Tr√°nsito üá™üá® (@CTEcuador) [#ElNuevoEcuadorResuelve] [pic.twitter.com/utxKjIPWvg] [June 6, 2024] Dicha instancia ha pedido la revisi√≥n de los contratos de delegaci√≥n de radares en las v√≠as estatales del pa√≠s que se gestionaron en el Gobierno anterior y, seg√∫n el r√©gimen actual, se elabor√≥ en un tiempo r√©cord para la contrataci√≥n p√∫blica (42 d√≠as), inobservando las normativas legales vigentes. La CTE se√±al√≥ que solicitar√° a la Contralor√≠a que realice a la brevedad posible un examen especial al referido concurso de delegaci√≥n a gestores privados y a los respectivos contratos. [‚ÄòEn nuestra lucha contra la corrupci√≥n rechazamos el contrato de delegaci√≥n de radares de la CTE‚Äô, dice Secretar√≠a de Integridad P√∫blica sobre equipos de control de velocidad en las v√≠as](https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/ecuador/secretaria-integridad-publica-rechaza-contrato-radares-cte-ecuador-nota/) El resto de radares distribuidos en otras provincias, como Guayas, Santa Elena, Azuay, Tungurahua, Manab√≠ y Cotopaxi, se mantienen vigentes y, por tanto, generan multas en caso de detectar infracciones.
